lexUnit.name: crash.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move with a smashing noise

sentence.text: She was standing on the tree that had crashed across the fence , looking like a garden plant in need of marriage guidance .
He kicked the chair aside with a violence that sent it crashing across the floor .
The car ahead of them squealed to a halt , crashed backwards across the road into a stone wall , and came to an abrupt stop .
They crashed from the raised platform at the stern , down among the feet , of the rowers who hastily jumped out of their way .
A badly-balanced packet of tapioca crashed from shelf to floor and burst open like a ripe seed-pod .
Heart filled with pathos , I slipped through one of the windows , and stepped gingerly around the saplings and splintered tiles , afraid I might crash into the cellar .
The car reels and swerves up on to the pavement , crashing into a shopfront and shattering itself and the window panes .
It came crashing through the window .
Burning timbers crashed to the ground , to be extinguished in the billowing cloud of dust .
It occurred to him as he was crashing about in the cupboard among his own old mackintoshes , tennis racquets , gum boots , and broken picture frames that he might be doing the wrong thing .
All over the island tall old trees crashed down , and less tall trees whipped about and were filleted of their leaves and branches .
Any moment the glass would come crashing down .
Fighting against the wind we ran along the beach and watched a steel grey North Sea crashing in .
` We have a newspaper ! " he yelled as he crashed in , mopping the sweat from his brow .
Stephen snapped with alarm as she crashed in , slamming the door behind her and leaning against it , panting .
He was disturbed when his 2 attackers crashed in through a back door .
It hurls itself around the island and in seconds the sea is alive , ugly waves crashing over the boats , white horses flicking over the surface on the hooves of the wind .
20ft seas were running into the entrance and crashing over the sea walls and visibility was virtually non-existent in the rain , spume and spray .
The wheels of the cart rumbled and crashed over the obstacle , and Alexei jumped smartly to one side to avoid the form which sprawled in his path .
Panting , Theda groped her way through the thick undergrowth , her direction signalled by Benedict crashing through ahead of her , and the howls of the dog growing ever louder .
I made myself very small as the stags crashed down the heathery , birch-studded hillside .
I watched in alarm as the rapidly rotating bundle crashed down the slope , jettisoning bits and pieces as it went .
On 18 May a magnitude 5 earthquake triggered a failure of the bulge and a huge landslide crashed down the mountain .
And it crashed back into me at high speed .
We portage the bridge , cross the canal , into the mill stream , crash down through the slalom poles , do n't quite make the sharp lefthand bend yet again and pull into Newbury .
If he shouted aloud then -- as in the high alpine passes -- the rocks would crash down on him .
The famous chandelier , with its thousand lights , broke away from its ropes and crashed down on to the people below .
Somebody bursts out of the toilet and crashes out into the noise .
This was hard with Boris crashing around , with two Villa Russe kitchenmaids in his wake .
Tom put the blacks up in the front room , crashed around in the darkness and lit the gas and oil lamps .
